definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: The pavement thus laid is to be plained and polished.
sentences.chinese: 這樣鋪的路面需要弄平弄光滑。

sentences.english: She looked at him, and smoothed out her apron with one hand.
sentences.chinese: 她看着他，用一隻手把圍裙弄平。

sentences.english: I flattened the entire image at this point.
sentences.chinese: 我在這點弄平整個的形象。

sentences.english: She uncrossed her legs and smoothed her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她放下交叉的腿，弄平裙子。

sentences.english: Level off the shelves with a spirit level.
She stooped to pick up the handkerchief and smoothed it out on the table.
sentences.chinese: 她彎腰撿起手帕在桌子上把它弄平。

sentences.english: She was smoothing out the creases in her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她正設法弄平裙子上的褶皺。

sentences.english: Every time she got up from a seat, she always smoothed out the crease in her dress.
sentences.chinese: 她每次從座位上站起來時，總是把連衣裙上的皺弄平。

sentences.english: That path is too high; level it down from here.
sentences.chinese: 那條路太高，從這裏把它弄平。

sentences.english: Thesheets on my bed have rucked up.
sentences.chinese: 她弄平了牀單上的皺褶。

sentences.english: With her trowel she turned the soil over and over, and smoothed it and patted it firm.
sentences.chinese: 她用泥鏟把土翻了又翻，又弄平，再拍結實。

sentences.english: Simply spray them on your clothes and smooth the surface with your hands.
sentences.chinese: 簡單地噴在你的衣服上並用手弄平衣服的表面。

sentences.english: And I can beat the dents out of little pots.
sentences.chinese: 而且我也能弄平小鍋上的凹痕。

sentences.english: Gathering Foot: for even, permanent shirring.
sentences.chinese: 她弄平了牀單上的皺褶。

sentences.english: She smoothed out wrinkles out of the tablecloth.
sentences.chinese: 她把桌布上的皺褶弄平。

sentences.english: She smoothed away the creases from a bedsheet.
sentences.chinese: 她弄平了牀單上的皺褶。

definition: welt seam (doubled over and sewed again from topside)
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
to sell at a 50% discount/to fold in two
